title: Permabanned for being toxic in a 5 man que with 4 of my best friends.
body:
Honestly I don't think this is fair.

Now I understand that my chat logs would DEFINITELY be considered toxic if I was talking to strangers. However, anyone who has a close group of friends knows that you can act differently with them because you know their feelings wont get hurt. I mess around with my friends all the time and they know I am joking with them, however the automated system, (or whoever was reading my chat logs,) did not seem to be able to put together the fact that:
1. I was in a 5 man group talking in only team chat.
2. My teammates names where ZGM Heritage, ZGM Pyro, [ZGM] Cherufe, and shosho613WINMODE (no name change)
3. All four of them are in my club and we all use the ZGM tag.
4. If the stats are available you can see that I play around 90% of my games with this group. (+ ZGM Jewpacabra, ZGM Penguin, r3lax) All in ZGM Club.

I hope this misunderstanding can be resolved. I will post the chat log bellow and a link to the game I played.

http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=ZGM+Permabanned# 5th game down


Anyway, hopefully I can get some clarification on this misunderstanding.

EDIT: I would add the chat log however since I was actually (a little) mad at my friends, because you know how friendships are, there is a lot of personal stuff in there that I don't think would be proper to post on the boards.

EDIT 2: I was 14 day banned on this account (and deserved it) around half a year ago, that was my latest behavioral penalty.

replies.body:
That is not the game that triggered the perma ban. The perma was triggered by the first game in your reform card, where you were reported by multiple players for using hate speech in all chat towards the enemy and harassing your teammates.

However, in the premade game you are speaking of, you did leave/afk and were reported because of this. Which is why it is showing in your logs.

So one game got me permabnned?

Assuming the second game has no effect because I was in 5 man premade who understood my situation.

You've had 4 different punishments in the last 4 months. This will certainly guarantee an escalation of your next punishment. That, coupled with our zero tolerance policy towards hate speech will result in a perma.

The language and attitude you used is 100% not welcome in this community.

If you disagree with me, you are certainly welcome to post the chat logs and we can have an open conversation about it.

Ok I understand now that I was banned for only this one game:

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=zG1wxdh4,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2016-04-06T17:59:56.707+0000)
>
> That is not the game that triggered the perma ban. The perma was triggered by the first game in your reform card, where you were reported by multiple players for using hate speech in all chat towards the enemy and harassing your teammates.
> 
> However, in the premade game you are speaking of, you did leave/afk and were reported because of this. Which is why it is showing in your logs.

I knew Riot kept track of how many reports get sent through per game. Sure, only one triggers the autochecker. But it would definitely be weird from a statistical standpoint to ignore how many reports a player gets.
Who reported you though?

One of my friends I think lel.

We kinda troll each other and do that. You can understand.

Find a different way to troll each other.
Abuse of the report system is unacceptable.

So, you guys use Riot's communication services (over which they have absolute authority by law and of which there exist numerous alternatives for premades) to act toxic to each other, then **REPEATEDLY** use the anti-toxicity tools that Riot spent time & money developing to report each other, then cry when Riot finally drops the hammer?

The level of idiocy at work her is unreal, you must be prepubescent children and think running a business is some kind of college house party. This is equivalent to you clowns pointing loaded guns at each other as some moronic "joke", one of you secretly making prank calls to the police department as a "joke", and then crying when they finally show up and put you in handcuffs. And then you beg the officer for release by saying:

_"One of my friends made the call but we don't know which one 'lel'. But we kinda point loaded guns at each other, you can understand. We share the neighborhood with other people but we only do this in our own house so it's nothing you have to worry about."_

This is how Riot interprets your actions and I no longer have any sympathy for your case. I was willing to give you a chance until I learned you spam the report system on each other. Taking actions that go against all common sense results in negative consequences, this is how life works get used to it. I sincerely hope that you never get your account back, would force you to learn your lesson from this before you become a member of society and decide to fuck up on a larger scale.
{{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}}
Your own friends report you hahahaha the IQ levels are through the roof ;)

The system usually doesn't fast ban unless it's hardcore hate speech, it needs a couple of reports. So either your chat did have some serious hate speech in there, or more likely some salty solo players tired of being stomped by premades reported you out of spite triggering a review of your chat logs, which were determined to be exceedingly toxic.]

**EDIT:** I don't care who's feelings did or didn't get hurt. You got banned for having zero common sense and playing with people just like you. Maybe this will teach you a lesson.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=zG1wxdh4,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2016-04-05T23:49:58.230+0000)

So either your chat did have some serious hate speech in there, or more likely some salty solo players tired of being stomped by premades reported you out of spite triggering a review of your chat logs, which were determined to be exceedingly toxic.]
> 
> **EDIT:** I don't care who's feelings did or didn't get hurt. You got banned for having zero common sense and playing with people just like you. Maybe this will teach you a lesson.


Except that reporting people for losing hard ot the enemy is considered a false report and has no weight to being banned.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=unobngtr,comment-id=00000000000000010001000200000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-04-05T18:00:32.861+0000)
>
> Actually, Erdrik is correct here.
> 
> A report flags a game for review. They do not establish guilt. The game is then reviewed for harassment, feeding, etc. This is why 'troll reporting' or 'gang reporting' do not work. False or inaccurate reports are thrown out.
> 
> You cannot ever be punished for saying nothing .. unless of course it's for something gameplay related like feeding, afking or cheating. But, you can never be punished for offensive language, hate speech or verbal abuse if you said nothing.


If he got banned, he was banned for bringing his toxicity to the enemy as well as his allies, and was blatant.

A report made in spite may not have any actual credibility, but the system is automated and it's just another variable. Players often use non-hateful curse words in game and don't get banned (like about game mechanics, dirty jokes etc.) because no one is actually taking offense to it so the system doesn't auto-flag it, it knows foul language was used but won't act on it. If someone used a litany of foul words like the OP did, the system probably took note of the game and was waiting for ANY reports simply to trigger a review of the chatlogs. Whether the verdict was rendered by a machine or a human, he got banned because they saw excessive foul/aggressive language and abuse of another player. Although he allegedly said nothing to opposing teams and the full premade situation should be taken into consideration, it's still Riot's game and they have final say in how any two players can treat each other. A man in a supermarket can't start smacking his girlfriend around because she tolerates abuse (yes this happens), then get surprised when the manager kicks him out or calls the police.
Jewpacabra is pretty offensive implying all Jews are blood suckers.  You hanging out with a dude like that tells me all I need to know about you and this is a good ban.
